data.text: Howbeit hear, Job, my words,
For behold, I have opened my mouth,
My heart shall be found pure by my words;
The Divine Spirit is that which formed me,
If thou canst, give me an answer:
Thou art formed out of the clay as also I:
My fear shall not terrify thee,
But thou hast said in mine ears
I am blameless, for I have not transgressed.
Yet he has discovered a charge against me,
And he has put my foot in the stocks,
For how sayest thou, I am righteous, yet he has not hearkened to me?
But thou sayest, Why has he not heard every word of my cause?
For when the Lord speaks once,
sending a dream,
Then opens he the understanding of men:
To turn a man from unrighteousness,
He spares also his soul from death,
And again, he chastens him with sickness on his bed,
And he shall not be able to take any food,
Until his flesh shall be consumed,
His soul also draws nigh to death,
Though there should be a thousand messengers of death,
He will support him, that he should not perish,
And he will make his flesh tender as that of a babe,
And he shall pray to the Lord, and his prayer shall be accepted of him;
Even then a man shall blame himself, saying,
Deliver my soul, that it may not go to destruction,
Behold, all these things the Mighty One works
And he has delivered my soul from death,
Hearken, Job, and hear me:
If thou hast words, answer me:
If not, do thou hear me:
